definitions.definition: a sweet dish eaten at the end of a meal

examples.text: I haven't made a pudding today.

definitions.definition: a hot sweet dish, often like a cake, made from flour, fat and eggs with fruit, jam, etc. in or on it
a hot dish like a pie with soft pastry made from flour, fat and eggs and usually filled with meat
a cold dessert (= a sweet dish) like cream that tastes of fruit, chocolate, etc.
used to say that you think somebody has done more than is necessary, or has added unnecessary details to make something seem better or worse than it really is

examples.text: If you're telling lies, keep it simple—never over-egg the pudding.

definitions.definition: you can only judge if something is good or bad when you have tried it

wordOrigin: Middle English (denoting a sausage such as black pudding): apparently from Old French boudin ‘black pudding’, from Latin botellus ‘sausage, small intestine’.
